ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 110 05 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 110 05 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: This course gives a VERY general overview of the product development process. There is no hands on instruction on how to build your product. So in the end the products are very simple and could have been done by middle schoolers. so if you wanna work in teams to build say a cardboard laundry folder go ahead and take this. if you wanna learn how to really design and fabricate products, look somewhere else.
Great course! Organization is sometimes confusing, but overall, I would definitely recommend it.
Easy and laid back, fun too! A great 5th or even 6th class.
Very, very manageable course that actually teaches actual transferable skills.

It was a good 5th class to take. Being in a group and having a group project definitely makes the workload more manageable, but try to get everything done when it's due otherwise it can really build up at the end.
Definitely take this class. you learn how to create a new product and actually make the product in this class.

Take it if you want a fairly easy credit. Be warned, however, that if you actually enjoy academic pursuits and are not at Yale just to be "along for the ride", you will feel very empty by the end of the course because you won't get much out of it. But you very likely will emerge with a GPA-boosting grade. Be sure to email the instructor before the semester starts if you want a spot in the class.
